properties.NAME: Harry Hays Building
properties.FACILITY: Neighbourhood : smaller size facility to service population of 10,000 or less
properties.FACILITY_F: Built in 1978
properties.DESCRIPTIO: The federal building in downtown Calgary, the Harry Hays Building, is named in his honour. The building is an 8-story, 671,500 square foot building covering an entire block next to the Bow River, designed by Chandler Kennedy and completed in 1978.

properties.NAME: Telus Sky
properties.ADDRESS: 685 Centre St S, Calgary, AB T2G 2C7
properties.FACILITY: Community: mid size facility to service population of 40,000 plus
properties.FACILITY_F: Built in 2015
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Flat asphalt surface, 10 components, City run learn to skateboard programs, City run skateboard camps in summer
properties.DESCRIPT_1: Surface d'asphalte plane, 10 modules, programmes et camps de planche à roulettes en été géré par la Ville

properties.NAME: Peace Bridge
properties.FACILITY: Community : mid size facility to service population of 40,000 plus
properties.FACILITY_F: Built in March 2010
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Peace Bridge is a bridge that accommodates people walking and cycling across the Bow River in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. The bridge, designed by Spanish architect Santiago Calatrava, opened for use on March 24, 2012. It has the popular nickname 'Finger Trap Bridge' for its visual similarity to the finger trap puzzle

properties.NAME: Central Library
properties.FACILITY: Metcalfe Community Centre - Roving Skateboard Park Location
properties.FACILITY_F: Built in 2013
properties.DESCRIPTIO: The Calgary Central Library, also known as the Calgary New Central Library, is a public library in Calgary, Alberta, Canada, and the flagship branch of the Calgary Public Library system

properties.NAME: Calgary Tower
properties.FACILITY: Johnny Leroux Stittsville Community Arena - Roving Skateboard Park Location
properties.FACILITY_F: Built in February 19, 1967
properties.DESCRIPTIO: The Calgary Tower is a 190.8-meter free standing observation tower in the downtown core of Calgary, Alberta, Canada

properties.NAME: Bow Tower
properties.ADDRESS: 500 Centre St S, Calgary, AB T2G 0E3
properties.FACILITY: District: larger facility to service population of 100,000 plus
properties.FACILITY_F: Built June 13, 2007
properties.DESCRIPTIO: The Bow is a 158,000-square-metre office building in downtown Calgary, Alberta, Canada. The 236 metre building is currently the second tallest office tower in Calgary, since construction of Cenovus' Brookfield Place; and the third tallest in Canada outside Toronto
properties.DESCRIPT_1: Grand bol de béton, modules de rue et modules verticaux, 17 000 pi2

properties.NAME: Studio Bell, home of the National Music Centre
properties.FACILITY: Neighbourhood : smaller size facility to service population of 10,000 or less
properties.FACILITY_F: Built in 2013, opened Canada Day 2016
properties.DESCRIPTIO: The National Music Centre is a non-profit museum and performance venue located in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. The centre's permanent building, branded Studio Bell

properties.NAME: Brookfield Place
properties.FACILITY: Neighbourhood : smaller size facility to service population of 10,000 or less
properties.FACILITY_F: Built in 2017
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Brookfield Place is a skyscraper located in downtown Calgary, Alberta, Canada. The complex is home to Brookfield Place East, a 56-storey 247 m office tower, which upon its completion in 2017, became the tallest building in Calgary, exceeding The Bow

properties.NAME: Bankers Hall
properties.ADDRESS: Bankers Hall, 315 8 Ave SW #402, Calgary, AB T2P 4K1
properties.FACILITY: Fitzroy Harbour Community Centre - Roving Skateboard Park Location
properties.FACILITY_F: Banker's Hall East built in 1989; Banker's Hall West built in 2000
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Bankers Hall is a building complex located in downtown Calgary, Alberta, which includes twin 52-storey office towers (197 metres high), designed by the architectural firm Cohos Evamy in postmodern architectural style

properties.NAME: Home Oil Tower
properties.FACILITY: Walter Baker Sports Centre - Roving Skateboard Park Location
properties.FACILITY_F: Built in 1977
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Home Oil Tower is part of a high-rise office skyscraper complex in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. It is located at 324 8 Avenue SW, on historic Stephen Avenue in downtown Calgary

properties.NAME: Sunlife Plaza
properties.FACILITY: Osgoode Community Centre - Roving Skateboard Park Location
properties.FACILITY_F: Built in 1981
properties.DESCRIPTIO: The Ampersand is a high-rise office complex in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. It consists of three identical skyscrapers, designated as North, West and East Tower, and connected by the lobby at ground level and by a shopping gallery at Plus 15 level

properties.NAME: Hotel Fairmont Palliser
properties.NOTES: Outdoor (Commemoratively named Charlie Bowins Skateboard Park on June 10, 2015)
properties.FACILITY: District: larger facility to service population of 100,000 plus
properties.FACILITY_F: Groundbreaking for the building was on May 12, 1911, on property owned by the CPR. It was built by P. Lyall and Sons Construction Company with materials such as stone, steel, reinforced concrete and brick at a cost of $1,500,000. The Palliser Hotel opened without any pomp or ceremony on June 1, 1914
properties.DESCRIPTIO: The Fairmont Palliser, formerly known as the Palliser Hotel, is a hotel of the Canada-based Fairmont Hotels and Resorts chain. The historic hotel (1914) is located in downtown Calgary, Alberta at 133 9th Avenue SW adjacent to the Calgary Tower and Palliser Square. The Palliser is one of Calgary's oldest and most luxurious hotels
properties.DESCRIPT_1: Surface de béton plane, 10 modules ou plus (grande demi-lune), programmes et camps de planche à roulettes en été géré par la Ville

properties.NAME: Calgary Courts Centre
properties.FACILITY: Neighbourhood : smaller size facility to service population of 10,000 or less
properties.FACILITY_F: Built 2007
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Calgary Courts Centre is the largest court facility in Canada, and is located in Calgary, Alberta.[4] It was constructed by the Government of Alberta and provides over 1 million square feet (90,000 m²) of court and office space

properties.NAME: First Tower
properties.FACILITY: Neighbourhood : smaller size facility to service population of 10,000 or less
properties.FACILITY_F: Built 1968
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Class A office space in the downtown core, with an entire floor at the Plus 15 level dedicated to the employee experience. A new way to attract and retain the best talent in the market — where office space puts people first.

properties.NAME: Bow Valley Square
properties.FACILITY: Neighbourhood : smaller size facility to service population of 10,000 or less
properties.FACILITY_F: Built 1972
properties.DESCRIPTIO: Bow Valley Square is a four-tower office tower complex located in downtown Calgary, Alberta, Canada. The complex constructed in stages between 1972 and 1982 was home to Calgary's tallest building between 1974 and 1976. The complex is owned by Alberta Investment Management Corporation, OMERS and Oxford Properties Group.
